name: CreateErrorTrackingRelease
description:
Create a new error tracking release for a project.

Use this tool to create a new error tracking release for a specified project within Datadog. This can help manage and track errors in different project environments, ensuring a systematic approach to error monitoring.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: ID of the project for which to create an error tracking release. Obtainable via /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: error_release_id
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the error tracking release to be accessed or modified.

parameters.name: hash_identifier
parameters.description: Unique string identifier for the release hash. Required for tracking specific releases.

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The integer ID of the team associated with the error tracking release. Required to specify the team context in Datadog.

parameters.name: release_creation_timestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp indicating when the error tracking release was created. Format should be ISO 8601 (e.g., 2023-10-02T14:48:00Z).

parameters.name: release_version
parameters.description: The version identifier for the new error tracking release.

parameters.name: project_name
parameters.description: The name of the project for which you want to create an error tracking release.

parameters.name: release_metadata
parameters.description: Optional metadata for the error tracking release. Provide additional information in a string format.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
